w:r.w:t: The student will be introduced to the different colors in this lesson. Knowing different colors are key adjectives that the student needs to know to help with describing different things and building an English vocabulary. The student will learn how to pro

nounce and spell different colors. The student will learn how to describe different objects and things with different colors using words they learned already in previous lessons. The student will response in complete sentences.
At completion of this lesson, student will be able to:
· Recognize, spell, and pronounce the words for colors
· Spell and pronounce commonly associated words
green, orange, black, white, brown, grey, red, yellow, purple, blue.
This slide will always be the
-branded opener slide that the teacher will display as the student enters the classroom.
Greet your student and introduce the lesson concept: Today, we are going to be learning about the different colors.
Say the correct name for each color.

Circle other colors that have the “r” sound.

Kinesthetic Cue: Help student with preparing their mouths for making an “r” sound. Some tips include biting gently down on their tongues to help them remember that their tongues need to press against their molars. Practice warming up with other similar sou
nds that use the same motion.
Review with student that the “r” sound can appear in the beginning, middle, or end of the word.
Circle for student where the “r” sound (i.e. the beginning of the word).
Have student circle other color words that have the “r” sound (i.e. orange, green, brown, grey)

Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide Number 21
Student should have a blank slide to draw a picture of different objects that have different colors.
green, orange, black, white, brown, g

Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
